thread.title: Immigration Went from Being Hotly Debated to Accepted in This Town
thread.title_full: Immigration Went from Being Hotly Debated to Accepted in This Town

title: Immigration Went from Being Hotly Debated to Accepted in This Town
text:
How Immigration Went from Being Hotly Debated to Accepted in One Pennsylvania Town 
In Hazleton, Pennsylvania — a town with a population of just 25,000 — residents at first resisted the Latino community’s explosive growth a decade ago. Today, attitudes have softened. Previous
